contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced|date=December 2009}} {{Nihongo|'''Iyomishima'''|伊予三島市|Iyomishima-shi}} was a [[cities of Japan|city]] located in [[Ehime Prefecture|Ehime]], [[Japan]]. On April 1, 2004 Iyomishima was merged with the town of [[Doi, Ehime|Doi]], the village of [[Shingū, Ehime|Shingū]], both from [[Uma District, Ehime|Uma District]], and the old city of [[Kawanoe, Ehime|Kawanoe]], to form the new city of [[Shikokuchūō, Ehime|Shikokuchūō]]. As of 2003, the city had an estimated [[population]] of 37,010 and the [[population density|density]] of 199.94 persons per km². The total area was 185.11 km². Iyomishima was known for the paper products industry and large industrial port on the Iyo-nada strait of the [[Seto Inland Sea]]. The city was founded on November 1, 1954. [[Category:Dissolved municipalities of Ehime Prefecture]] {{Ehime-geo-stub}}
